sectionHero.title: Subclass 500 Student visa
sectionHero.shortDescription: Find out all you need to know about the subclass 500 Student Visa, including processing time, eligibility and estimated fees.

detailInfo.title: Our Gateway to Studying in Australia
detailInfo.description: The Subclass 500 Student visa is your key to unlocking a world-class education in Australia. This visa allows you to pursue a full-time course of study at a registered Australian educational institution, including: Higher education: Universities, colleges, and vocational institutions offering degrees, diplomas, and advanced diplomas. Vocational Education and Training (VET): Courses focused on developing specific skills for employment in various industries. English language courses: Programs designed to improve your English language proficiency to meet academic or professional requirements.

sectionEligibility.title: Basic Requirements for Student visa Subclass 500 Eligibility

eligibility.title: Genuine student
eligibility.desc: You must genuinely intend to pursue full-time study in Australia.

eligibility.title: Financial resources
eligibility.desc: Demonstrate sufficient financial resources to support yourself during your studies.

eligibility.title: Health insurance
eligibility.desc: Have Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your visa.

eligibility.title: English language proficiency
eligibility.desc: Meet the minimum English language requirements for your chosen course.

sectionBenefits.title: Key Benefits of the Subclass 500 Visa

benefits.title: Study at renowned institutions
benefits.desc: Access a diverse range of educational opportunities from leading Australian universities and colleges.

benefits.title: Work while you study
benefits.desc: Gain valuable work experience and supplement your income with up to 40 hours of work per fortnight (when your course is in session).

benefits.title: Extend your stay
benefits.desc: Apply for subsequent student visas to continue your studies or transition to a work visa.

benefits.title: Explore Australia
benefits.desc: Meet the minimum English language requirements for your chosen course.

process.title: Choose your course and institution
process.desc: Research and select your desired course and educational provider.

process.title: Receive a Confirmation of Enrolment (COE):
process.desc: Obtain a COE from your chosen institution.

process.title: Meet the visa requirements
process.desc: Ensure you meet all eligibility criteria and gather the necessary documentation.

process.title: Submit your visa application
process.desc: Apply online through the Department of Home Affairs website.

faq.question: What is the Subclass 500 Student Visa?
faq.answer: The Subclass 500 Student Visa allows international students to study full-time at a registered Australian educational institution. This includes universities, colleges, vocational institutions, and English language courses.

faq.question: Who is eligible for the Subclass 500 Student Visa?
faq.answer:
To be eligible, you must:
  • Be enrolled in a registered course at a CRICOS-registered institution.
  • Meet the English language requirements for your chosen course.
  • Have sufficient financial resources to support yourself during your studies.
  • Meet health and character requirements.

faq.question: What are the different types of Subclass 500 Student Visas?
faq.answer:
There are several visa streams within Subclass 500, each catering to different student profiles:
  • Mainstream: For students seeking full-time study in higher education or vocational education and training (VET) programs
  • Meet the English language requirements for your chosen course.
  • Have sufficient financial resources to support yourself during your studies.
  • Meet health and character requirements.

sectionHero.title: Subclass 590 Student Guardian visa
sectionHero.shortDescription: Everything you need to know about the visa for being in Australia as a guardian, parent or relative.

detailInfo.title: Supporting Your Child's Education with the Student Guardian Visa
detailInfo.description: The Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa allows parents, legal guardians, or relatives to accompany and provide support to a student under 18 studying in Australia on a student visa. This visa ensures your child receives the necessary care and guidance while they pursue their educational goals in a new environment.

sectionEligibility.title: Basic Requirements for Student's Guardian visa Subclass 590 Eligibility

eligibility.title: Relationship to the student
eligibility.desc: You must be a parent, legal guardian, or relative of the student under 18 studying in Australia on a student visa.

eligibility.title: Financial resources
eligibility.desc: Demonstrate sufficient financial resources to support yourself and your dependent family members during your stay in Australia.

eligibility.title: Health insurance
eligibility.desc: Have Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your visa.

eligibility.title: English language proficiency
eligibility.desc: Meet the minimum English language requirements for the visa.

sectionBenefits.title: Key Benefits of the Subclass 590 Visa

benefits.title: Provide invaluable support
benefits.desc: Assist your child with daily needs, ensuring their well-being and academic success.

benefits.title: Peace of mind
benefits.desc: Have the comfort of knowing your child is safe and cared for while you are away.

benefits.title: Extend your stay
benefits.desc: The visa duration is linked to the student visa holder's stay or until they turn 18, allowing you to be present throughout their academic journey.

process.title: Confirm your eligibility
process.desc: Ensure you meet all the requirements for the visa.

process.title: Gather documentation
process.desc: Collect the necessary documents, including evidence of your relationship to the student, financial resources, and health insurance.

process.title: Submit your visa application
process.desc: Apply online through the Department of Home Affairs website.

faq.question: What is the Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa?
faq.answer: The Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa allows parents, legal guardians, or relatives to accompany and provide support to a student under 18 years old studying in Australia on a student visa.

faq.question: Who is eligible for the Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa?
faq.answer:
To be eligible, you must:
  • Be the parent, legal guardian, or a relative of the student under 18 studying in Australia on a student visa.
  • Meet the English language requirements for the visa.
  • Have sufficient financial resources to support yourself and your dependent family members during your stay in Australia.
  • Meet health and character requirements.

faq.question: What are the responsibilities of a Student Guardian?
faq.answer:
He Student Guardian is responsible for the welfare and well-being of the student under their care. This includes:
  • Providing accommodation and daily necessities.
  • Ensuring the student attends school regularly.
  • Monitoring the student's academic progress and welfare.
  • Making decisions regarding the student's health, education, and welfare.

faq.question: How long can I stay in Australia on a Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa?
faq.answer: The visa duration is linked to the student visa holder's stay or until they turn 18, allowing you to be present throughout their academic journey.

faq.question: Can I work while in Australia on a Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa?
faq.answer: You can study English language courses for up to 20 hours per week if you lodged your application on or after March 24, 2012. However, you cannot engage in paid employment outside of this.

faq.question: Do I need health insurance?
faq.answer: Yes, you must have Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your visa. OSHC provides access to essential medical services while residing in Australia.

faq.question: What are the English language requirements?
faq.answer: The English language requirements for the Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa are lower than those for other visa types. You can meet the requirements through tests like IELTS, TOEFL, or PTE.

faq.question: How much does it cost to apply for the Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa?
faq.answer: The visa application fee is currently AUD 370. Additional costs may include medical examinations, health insurance, and travel expenses.

faq.question: How long does it take to process a Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa?
faq.answer: Processing times can vary depending on individual circumstances and case complexity. Generally, it takes around 3-4 weeks to receive a decision.

faq.question: Where can I get more information?
faq.answer: The Department of Home Affairs website provides comprehensive information about the Subclass 590 Student Guardian Visa: https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/student-590

detailInfo.title: Upskill and Advance Your Career in Australia with the Subclass 407 Training Visa
detailInfo.description: The Subclass 407 Training Visa allows international individuals to acquire or enhance their skills through structured training in Australia. This visa is ideal for professionals seeking to:

eligibility.title: Increase your career opportunities
eligibility.desc: Enhance your resume and become a more competitive candidate in the Australian job market.

eligibility.title: Extend your stay

eligibility.title: Explore Australia

benefits.title: Increase your career opportunities

process.title: Obtain a nomination

process.title: Meet visa requirements
process.desc: Ensure you fulfill all eligibility criteria and gather required documentation.

process.title: Submit your visa application
process.desc: Apply online through the Department of Home Affairs website.

faq.question: What is the Subclass 407 Training Visa?
faq.answer:
The Subclass 407 Training Visa allows international individuals to acquire or enhance their skills through structured training programs in Australia. This visa is ideal for individuals seeking to:
  • Gain valuable occupational skills: Develop in-demand expertise in your chosen field through workplace-based training provided by Australian businesses and organizations.
  • Meet occupational registration requirements: Fulfill the necessary training components for professional registration in Australia.
  • Boost your career prospects: Enhance your employability and career advancement opportunities with specialized skills and experience.

faq.question: Who is eligible for the Subclass 407 Training Visa?
faq.answer:
To be eligible, you must:
  • Have a sponsor in Australia who will provide the training program and offer employment opportunities.
  • Meet skill requirements: Your skills and experience must be relevant to the training program and Australian job market.
  • Demonstrate sufficient financial resources to support yourself during your stay in Australia.
  • Meet health and character requirements.
  • Satisfy the English language requirements for the visa.

faq.question: What types of training activities are covered under the Subclass 407 visa?
faq.answer:
A variety of training activities are eligible, including:
  • Occupational training: Improve skills in your chosen field, such as engineering, IT, healthcare, or hospitality.
  • Professional development: Participate in specialized training programs to enhance your knowledge and expertise in your current profession.
  • Capacity building: Undergo training programs designed to develop skills and expertise for overseas projects or initiatives.

process.title: Submit your visa application
